pageTitle: ENERGY DEVELOPMENT CO (ENERGYDEV:National Stock Exchange of India): Stock Quote & Company Profile - Businessweek
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {12525=Energy Development Co. Ltd. announced that they will report Q4, 2015 results on May 28, 2015, 4780=Energy Development Company Limited, together with its subsidiaries, generates and sells electricity from water and wind in India. The company operates through two divisions, Generating and Contract. It has 19 MW of renewable energy capacity and has 291 MW of hydroelectric projects at various stages of development. The company owns and operates 9 MW and 6 MW Harangi hydro electric power plants; and 1.5 MW wind mill at Hasssan District and 1.5 MW wind mill at Chitradurga in the state of Karnataka, as well as a 7 MW Ullankal hydro electric power project and 15 MW Karrikayam hydro electric power project in the state of Kerala. It is also executing 12 hydro electric projects in the state of Arunachal Pradesh having an aggregate capacity of approximately 555 MW; and 3 projects at Uttarakhand with an aggregate capacity of approximately 17 MW. In addition, the company is involved in the infrastructure development, such as construction of bridges, operation and maintenance of hydro projects, supply of materials, etc. Further, it develops energy and infrastructure projects for other developers; and provides consultancy services comprising turnkey solutions, operation and maintenance, and revamps of old hydro plants, as well as development of other renewable energies. Additionally, the company offers engineering, consultancy, and project management services ranging from concept and design to construction and commissioning for hydroelectric power plants; engineering, procurement, and construction services; third party power plant operations and maintenance services; and rehabilitation, renovation, modernization, and uprating consultancy and services for ageing hydro power plants. Energy Development Company Limited was incorporated in 1995 and is based in Kolkata, India., 9365=Energy Development Company Ltd. announced audited standalone earnings results for the fourth quarter and year ended March 31, 2015 and consolidated earnings results for the year ended March 31, 2015. For the quarter, on a standalone basis, the company reported net sales/income from operations of INR 43.536 million compared to INR 85.165 million a year ago. Loss from operations before other income, finance costs and exceptional items was INR 16.723 million compared to INR 19.419 million a year ago. Loss from ordinary activities before tax was INR 3.265 million compared to INR 10.220 million a year ago. Net profit was INR 0.692 million compared to INR 4.288 million a year ago. Basic and diluted EPS before and after extraordinary items was INR 0.03 compared to INR 0.16 a year ago. For the year, on a standalone basis, the company reported net sales/income from operations of INR 217.627 million compared to INR 387.497 million a year ago. Profit from operations before other income, finance costs and exceptional items was INR 29.063 million compared to INR 31.628 million a year ago. Profit from ordinary activities before tax was INR 13.902 million compared to INR 6.483 million a year ago. Net profit was INR 13.800 million compared to INR 22.068 million a year ago. Basic and diluted EPS before and after extraordinary items was INR 6.87 compared to INR 5.95 a year ago. For the year, on a consolidated basis, the company reported net sales/income from operations of INR 381.587 million compared to INR 492.140 million a year ago. Profit from operations before other income, finance costs and exceptional items was INR 50.498 million compared to INR 15.827 million a year ago. Loss from ordinary activities before tax was INR 134.233 million compared to INR 123.930 million a year ago. Net loss was INR 139.385 million compared to INR 102.827 million a year ago. Basic and diluted LPS before and after extraordinary items was INR 6.29 compared to INR 4.96 a year ago., 11705=Energy Development Company Ltd. announced that the Board of Directors of the company at its meeting held on May 28, 2015, has recommended payment of dividend at the rate of 5% on the paid-up share capital of the company (INR 0.50 per equity shares of INR 10 each) for the financial year 2014-15 (subject to approval of members at the ensuing Annual General Meeting). The dividend, if approved, shall be paid within 30 days from the date of the Annual General Meeting.}
